name: transport, freight, conveyor belt | transport, freight, conveyor belt | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19154/documentation

This activity describes the transport of bulk materials, such as ores or hard coal, by means of an industrial, overland conveyor belt. This type of conveyor belt is specifically designed for heavy industrial applications and freight transport. It is therefore not applicable for lighter applications such as for example conveyors at logistic distribution centers, airport luggage claims, supermarket cash desks etc. Following are exemplary images.;Most commonly such conveyors are used for short distance transport of bulk material within an industrial site, but also longer-distance transport over several kilometers can be done cost effectively with modern conveyor technology  (Shipp, n.d.).;Reference(s): Shipp S., n.d., Advances in Conveyor Technology, https://www.beumergroup.com/uploads/tx_bbbrochures/BEUMER_WP_Conveyor_Advances.pdf, accessed 16.02.2018)

The activity starts after loading of the material on the conveyor
.

The activity ends before unloading of the material from the conveyor.
category: H:Transportation and storage/49:Land transport and transport via pipelines/492:Other land transport

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The dataset represents the operation of average conveyor technology operational in 2010. With an estimated lifetime of 30 years it can be expected that this represents average conveyor technology at least until 2020.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: generic data, not specific to a geography
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Energy efficiency of the conveyor reflects conventional conveyor technology in 2010.

exchanges.description: Own assumption. Amount of waste oil corresponding to halft the amount of lubricating oil needed for maintenance. The other half is assumed to be released to soil.

exchanges.description:
Estimation for average energy requirements of belt conveyors used for transport of heavy bulk materials such as mining ores or hard coal based on reports by Beumer Group (n.d.) (0.2 kWh/tkm) and Günthner et al. (2010) (0.127-0.38kWh/tkm) and a study by Norgate and Haque (2013) (0.162 kW h/tkm). Reference(s): Beumer Group (n.d.). Advances in Conveyor Technology. Retreived online from <https://www.beumergroup.com/uploads/tx_bbbrochures/WP_Advances_in_Conveyor_Technology.pdf>, 28 August 2017
 W. A. Günthner, Ch. Tilke, S. Rakitsch (2010). Energy Efficiency in Bulk Materials Handling. In: bulk solids handling, Vol. 30 (2010), No. 3, Pages 138 - 142. Online from <http://www.fml.mw.tum.de/fml/images/Publikationen/G%C3%BCnthner_Tilke_Rakitsch_BulkSolidsHandling_03-10_EnergyEfficiency.pdf>, 28 August, 2017
Norgate, T., Haque, N., 2013, The greenhouse gas impact of IPCC and ore-sorting technologies. Online at <https://ac-els-cdn-com.proxy.lib.chalmers.se/S0892687512003810/1-s2.0-S0892687512003810-main.pdf?_tid=f7b863ec-af2f-11e7-997f-00000aacb362&acdnat=1507800801_3a6e9732b324c9ef50eb17117d56d913>, accessed 12 October 2017.

exchanges.description: Own assumption: need of lubricating oil for maintenance of 1000kg per year. Divided by average yearly capacity of about 300000tkm in case studies in Gänther et al. (2010). Reference(s): W. A. Günthner, Ch. Tilke, S. Rakitsch (2010). Energy Efficiency in Bulk Materials Handling. In: bulk solids handling, Vol. 30 (2010), No. 3, Pages 138 - 142. Online from <http://www.fml.mw.tum.de/fml/images/Publikationen/G%C3%BCnthner_Tilke_Rakitsch_BulkSolidsHandling_03-10_EnergyEfficiency.pdf>, 28 August, 2017

exchanges.description:
Average amount of meters of conveyor required for the transport of 1tkm derived from two case studies reported by Günther et al. (2010). Mind that this number may vary depending on the specific application and shall hence be evaluated for the case of application. 
Reference(s): W. A. Günthner, Ch. Tilke, S. Rakitsch (2010). Energy Efficiency in Bulk Materials Handling. In: bulk solids handling, Vol. 30 (2010), No. 3, Pages 138 - 142. Online from <http://www.fml.mw.tum.de/fml/images/Publikationen/G%C3%BCnthner_Tilke_Rakitsch_BulkSolidsHandling_03-10_EnergyEfficiency.pdf>, 28 August, 2017
